Referee Martin Atkinson was criticised by Manchester City's manager Mark Hughes for bad time-keeping. The fourth official had signalled four minutes of additional time, but Michael Owen scored a 96th-minute goal.

Atkinson was defended by former referee Graham Poll, himself considered one of England's greatest officials, who pointed out that during injury time itself there had been a goal celebration, a substitution and a delay caused by a fan on the pitch.

Atkinson was defended by former referee Graham Poll, himself considered one of England's greatest officials, who pointed out that during injury time itself there had been a goal celebration, a substitution and a delay caused by a fan on the pitch.

Referee Martin Atkinson was criticised by Manchester City's manager Mark Hughes for bad time-keeping. The fourth official had signalled four minutes of additional time, but Michael Owen scored a 96th-minute goal.

Atkinson was defended by former referee Graham Poll, himself considered one of England's greatest officials, who pointed out that during injury time itself there had been a goal celebration, a substitution and a delay caused by a fan on the pitch.

Referee Martin Atkinson was criticised by Manchester City's manager Mark Hughes for bad time-keeping. The fourth official had signalled four minutes of additional time, but Michael Owen scored a 96th-minute goal.

Atkinson was defended by former referee Graham Poll, himself considered one of England's greatest officials, who pointed out that during injury time itself there had been a goal celebration, a substitution and a delay caused by a fan on the pitch.
